tr.td: Basal H2O2 production rate in the absence of external H2O2 Determined by a fitting procedure to data in Figure 6.
H2O2 transport rate across cell membrane. Taken from Figure 1—figure supplement 1C.
H2O2 scavenging rate. Derived from the absolute adaptation concentration Iabs in Figure 3.
Antioxidant transcription rate. Derived from the absolute adaptation concentration Iabs in Figure 3.
Antioxidant mRNA decay rate. See the linear model above for the determination of parameter value.
Antioxidant translation rate. Derived from the absolute adaptation concentration Iabs in Figure 3.
Antioxidant protein decay rate. Tsa1 is a stable protein, therefore, the decay is due to the dilution rate set by cell growth (doubling time ~ 100 min).
Order of magnitude of internal H2O2 at which antioxidant. transcription saturates. Taken from Figure 6—figure supplement 1C.
Order of magnitude of internal H2O2 at which H2O2 scavenging rate saturates. The ratio K/W ~ 1 gave the best fit to curves in Figure 6, hence the order of magnitude of this parameter.
